docs.name: Foreman
docs.info: Foreman v2 is stable and recommended for use. You may use v2 by either passing ‘version=2’ in the Accept Header or using api/v2/ in the URL.

methods.name: create
methods.full_description: Adds role ‘Anonymous’ to the user by default
examples:
POST /api/users
{
  "user": {
    "login": "new_admin",
    "auth_source_id": "980190962"
  }
}
200
{
  "id": 980190974,
  "login": "new_admin",
  "firstname": null,
  "lastname": null,
  "mail": null,
  "admin": true,
  "auth_source_id": 980190962,
  "auth_source_name": "ldap-server",
  "last_login_on": null,
  "created_at": "2014-08-07T20:41:58Z",
  "updated_at": "2014-08-07T20:41:58Z",
  "default_location": null,
  "default_organization": null,
  "locations": [],
  "organizations": [],
  "auth_source_ldap": {
    "id": 980190962,
    "type": "AuthSourceLdap",
    "name": "ldap-server"
  },
  "roles": [
    {
      "name": "Anonymous",
      "id": 7
    }
  ],
  "usergroups": []
}

methods.name: update
methods.full_description: Adds role ‘Anonymous’ to the user if it is not already present. Only another admin can change the admin account attribute.
examples:
PUT /api/users/980190969
{
  "user": {
    "login": "johnsmith",
    "mail": "john@example.com",
    "auth_source_id": "200482051",
    "password": "123456"
  }
}
200
{
  "admin": null,
  "auth_source_id": 200482051,
  "avatar_hash": null,
